result.execSummary:
The defendant John P Nelsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Imp.Animal Shelter Space, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(3)(b).
  • Intentionally Imp.Animal Shelter Space, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will review an early release from probation, if the Defendant complies with counseling and recommendations of probation officer.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must undergo a mental health assessment and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must not care for or own any livestock for farming purposes.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes: Must be completed within the first 6 months of probation.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John P Nelsen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John P Nelsen in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement reached.  Motion Hearing not needed.
Amended Information filed with Court.
Plead guilty to both counts and SW - 18 months probation.  Mental health assessment.   No livestock for farming purposes.  Early release from probation, if complies with counseling and recommendations of probation officer.  Court costs.
All other counts dismissed and read-in.  

Court questions defendant.  Defendant pleads guilty to both amended counts - Class A misdemeanors.  Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of counts 1 and 2 of Amended Information.
Argument by State.
Argument by Attorney Avoles.

Court relates and orders:  

SW -  2 years probation on each count to run concurrent.
Mental health assessment and follow up with any recommended treatments.
Not to care for or own any  livestock for farming purposes.
Any other treatment/evaluations recommended by probation and comply with recommended treatment.
Community service - 30 hours to be completed within first six months of probation.
Court costs. 
Cout will review an early release from probation, if complies with counseling and recommendations of probation officer.
Motion hearing on November 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Statements and Fruits of Search of Premises and Notice. Defendant's.

Defendant John P Nelsen in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:45 Redirect by State.

10:51 Cross by Defense
10:55 Testimony Closed.

Argument by State. Argument by Defense. 
Court relates and finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for trial. 
Information filed.
Defense waives formal reading. Defense enters not guilty pleas. 
Court grants Defense 10 days for motions following discovery. 
Bond continues. 
  Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
of Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection. Defendant's.
